name: Melody-webpage
body:
Melody Quintero

  • Photos
  • About Me
  • GWC Project

Hi, My name is Melody Quintero.

I'm an 18 year old and go to St. Benedict High School.

I enjoy playing video games, basketball and the guitar with my friends and family. As well as learning Computer Science. My Dream is to be an mechanical engineering and successful, so I can spoil my little siblings. Especially my little brother by the time he's my age. Since i was an 7th grade, I always wanted a career in engineering. As soon as I got to High school, I already had my mind set in engineering but I was never quick sure which field of engineering I wanted to pursue. Math has always been my best subject since I was in Elementary school. I loved math and design, yet I want to explorer Fuhrer. What spark my interest in technology is the same reason it would anyone else. It's all around us 24/7. Technology is growing faster and convenient everyday. I want to be part of the reason why technology is what it is. There's not lot of female craters and computer/technology designers out there. I had a friend, who knew how to program in freshmen year. It use to amaze me as it was a new form of art, I have yet to had soon. No Matter what I choice to pursue with mechanic or technological engineering. Whether the public eye like it or not, Technology would always continue to grow. By learning how to code/program, It would always put me a head of the game. Befitting my education and career in multiple varieties. I want to prove a point to anyone who has criticize or demolish a women abilities. My Personal goals to get from Girls Who Code is to continue as well as commit my passion with math in a whole new level.


City Scroller

Made using: Khan Academy Computer Science.

On the 3rd week of Girls Who Code, I got to work with my partner name Saloni. We spent the week working together as a team to crate a JavaScript code to built a City Scroller. We had building and mountains in the back moving the same directions. The user would be able to color of the build as they please.

Created by Melody Quintero ©
